intro: Schizocaena alternans, commonly known as the alternate schizocaena, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are alternately arranged along the stem. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the Apiaceae family. Schizocaena alternans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
